conversation.text: Hi! Are you ready to learn how to make new potatoes?
New potatoes? Are they just potatoes?
Well, I am pretty sure they are just potatoes but for some reason the title says "new potatoes".

Ah sorry, I understand now that new potatoes is actually a type of potatoes. They have thinner skin so you don't have to peel it. First, wash your potatoes with cold water and cut it into bit sized potatoes.
evidence: Wash the potatoes with cold water, taking care to scrub off dirt and other debris. Cut each potato into bite sized pieces; for small potatoes,

conversation.text: Awesome. Next place butter and oil on a skillet on medium heat. Cast iron skillet is recommended because it retains heat very well and creates a crispy shell of the potatoes.
evidence: Place the butter and oil in a skillet over medium heat

conversation.text: Great, now you can place the potatoes cut side down onto the pan. Cook them until the potatoes turn brown and crispy in about 5 minutes. Flip the potatoes over so they are evenly cooked.
evidence: Cook until the potatoes are brown and crispy, about five minutes.

conversation.text: Add some salt and pepper to the potatoes. You may also add some dried herbs too such as rosemary or thyme.
evidence: Season the potatoes with salt and pepper.

conversation.text: OK. Potatoes kind of stick to the pan now. Are they ready for serving?
Are the potatoes tender now? It may take 15 minutes of heating on medium-low heat with the lid on.
Okay, keep heating it on medium-low for around 15 minutes with the lid on. Make sure they don't overcook!
evidence: Reduce the heat to medium low and allow the potatoes to cook until tender, about 15 minutes.

conversation.text: I'm afraid this will scorch the potatoes...
As soon as you think they are tender, you can remove it from the pan and serve!
Okay then. So we're done after this step?
Yes! Congratulations on making new potatoes!

procedure.description:
You'll need the following ingredients to make delicious pan-roasted new potatoes:
1 pound new potatoes
2 Tablespoons butter
1 Tablespoon olive oil
1 teaspoon fresh rosemary, chopped
Salt and pepper

procedure.summary: Place the butter and oil in a skillet over medium heat.
procedure.description: Allow the butter and oil to melt together. Cast iron cookware is ideal for pan-roasting potatoes; since it retains heat so well without getting too hot, it creates a crispy outer crust on the potatoes.

procedure.summary: Place the potatoes cut side down into the pan.
procedure.description: Cook until the potatoes are brown and crispy, about five minutes. Turn the potatoes so that each side gets brown.

procedure.summary: Season the potatoes with salt and pepper.
Cover the pan with a lid.
Remove the potatoes from the pan.
procedure.description: Serve as a side dish to accompany chicken, fish, or steak, or toss with arugula to make a salad.
